text: The 1908 Washington State football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1908 college football season. The team competed as an independent under head coach Walter Rheinschild, compiling a record of 4–0–2. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | October 10 | Eastern Washington | Home | 73-0 W | NA |- ! scope="row" | October 17 | Spokane YMCA | Home | 33-0 W | NA |- ! scope="row" | October 30 | Bremerton Navy | Home | 44-0 W | NA |- ! scope="row" | November 7 | Washington | Away | 6-6 T | NA |- ! scope="row" | November 14 | Idaho | Home | 4-4 T | NA |- ! scope="row" | November 21 | Whitman |Home | 4-0 W | NA |} ==References== Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:College football undefeated seasons Category:1908 in Washington (state)
